Introduction

Welcome to the ScreenKit Documentation! Here you can find all you need to know about ScreenKit and how to use it. First of all, ScreenKit is a development tool built by alombi that let the developer create some nice and Apple-like HTML pages super-quickly, like Welcome pages or Documentations theirselves.


How to implement

Once you have created your own page with ScreenKit, you'll have to export it. When you export a project, the HTML and CSS code is copied in your clipboard. All you have to do is:

  • Open your shortcut
  • Find the place where you want to place the HTML page
  • Add a "Text" action and paste the code
  • Add a "Set Name" action and put .html as extension (Example.html)
  • A "Quick Look" action.
  • Done!


Special text and lists

If you want to use stuff like bold, italic or lists, you have to use the HTML syntax


Support badge

If you'll use a page generated with ScreenKit, please link and credit my shortcut, pasting in your RoutineHub description this code:
